stories.text:
In 2021, Colorado passed a law called the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act that require all businesses to post salary ranges for every job posting. This applies to EVERY remote job that might be taken by a Coloradan. If you are hiring remote workers, are you in compliance? Are you ignoring it until someone complains? Have you never heard of it?

Edit: More information: https://cdle.colorado.gov/sites/cdle/files/INFO%20%239_%20Equal%20Pay%20Transparency%20Rules%20%28Revised%20July%202021%29.pdf
stories.title: Ask HN: Are You Complying with Colorado's Equal Pay for Equal Work Act?

stories.text: I know some jobs feel like a grind on some days, but for those who have a legitimate, heaving disinterest every work day, how do you get to the end? What pushes you to the next day?
